reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Namibia - Tuberculosis - Ministry of Health and Social Services of Namibia

description.narrative: Tuberculosis (TB) is a major public health problem in Namibia with the fourth highest TB incidence rate in Africa. About 67 percent of newly registered TB patients are HIV positive (Epidemiological Fact Sheet on HIV and AIDS, UNAIDS, September 2008). This Program will aim to achieve universal coverage of patient-centered DOTS while building upon existing successful models of community-based TB care (CBTBC) to achieve more than 90 percent patient-level coverage. Given the high TB/HIV co-morbidity in Namibia, the Program addresses coordination of TB/HIV activities at national and regional level. Data quality improvement and evidence creation to inform program implementation are key components of this Program. Its goal is to reduce tuberculosis transmission, morbidity and mortality to such a level that tuberculosis is no longer a public health problem. The Program will target TB suspects and TB patients (including those with clinical complications and HIV co-infection); marginalized communities and populations, including those living in rural areas; and the general population of the 13 regions in Namibia, with a focus on Omaheke region. This is a consolidation of the Round 10 and Rolling Continuation Channel (RCC) Round 2 TB grants.

Coverage / Output indicator for NMB-T-MoHSS
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
DOTS-other 1 : Percent of TB cases (all forms) under DOT provided through community based organzation (number and percentage)
Number of community sensitization sessions on Tuberculosis held
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
Percentage of new HIV-positive patients starting IPT during the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-positive patients who were screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings
DOTS-other 2 : Percentage of patients under CB-DOT
TB/HIV-other 1 : Proportion of registered HIV + TB patients on CPT
New smear-positive TB cases successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among the new smear-positive TB cases registered during a specified period (number and percentage)
Percentage of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB started on treatment for MDR-TB who were lost to follow up during the first six months of treatment
